English: as in the sound for dawn
as in the sound for how
as in the sound for bay, bayh
as in the sound for vehicle
as in the sound for English
as in the sound for gym
as in the sound for bomb
as in the sound for pond
What do you call that in Ponca?
What do you call this in Ponca?
I want to ask you something
I approach in a humble way
I don't understand why its that way
I want you to understand this
Good deed or done something good

Ponca: neeʰskeeʰthayʰ, thah ayyohⁿthayʰ xtee,gheeʰ thah thayʰᵗdayʰ

English: How was your day at work?
What do you want to eat today Mom?
Father (far away and you have to shout)
The medicine and the pipe are inside the tipi
The smoke is rising to the sky

Ponca: weeʰᵗdeeʰ gohⁿ ah’kah wayʰ theeⁿ gah[.]

English: Place the coals in the center
Put the tobacco in the west
Soldiers are made warriors are born
Ponca: wah’nohⁿshaʰmah, neeah’sheeⁿgah gah’xah sheeʰ, neeah’sheeⁿgah nah’gay theeʰ’

English: The bundle of sage is by the water bucket
The tobacco is on the west side of the tipi
There are many singers at the drum
We live because of our prayers
The cedar is from the east
The feather is from a golden eagle
There is rain in the clouds
Put the rocks in a circle
The water is outside the sweat lodge
Causing it to return back to me
I saw this in a dream
I will tell it to them
It is calm after the storm
The Ponca lived near the Black Hills
The buffalo has a strong heart
The little house was blue and white
The old man spoke to the people (large crowd)
The rattlesnake is on the path
The tribe walked a great distance
They are going to play ball
The hides are drying in the sun
The old people say love one another
We helped our children picking plums
Let it go or turn it loose
Older brother refering to something his brother has done
Go to the river and get water
